description: Southern Districts Cricket Club Inc. has been a proud part of the Northern Territory cricket community since its founding. Based at Gerry Wood Oval in the Freds Pass Reserve, the club competes in the Darwin & Districts Cricket Competition and offers inclusive programs for juniors, seniors, and women â€” fostering participation and growth at every level.

Established in 1981 with the formation of a D Grade team, the club became an incorporated association in 1982. A turf wicket was installed in 1985, paving the way for the club's entry into the A Grade competition in 1987.
Today, Southern Districts Cricket Club continues to promote teamwork, development, and community spirit through the game of cricket.

mission: To provide a welcoming and competitive environment for cricketers of all ages and abilities in the rural area, fostering skill development, sportsmanship, and a lifelong love for the game, while actively contributing to our local community.
